result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Christian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with sentence being served on Winnebago County case.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of extended supervision to be determined by Department of Corrections.

elements

D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Atty. Nielsen.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of the information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty on Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Statements by counsel.
The Court sentences the defendant to 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System.
ITOC - 18 months, term of EXS - 18 months.
This sentence is concurrent with the sentence being served on the Winnebago County case.
Defendant is eligible for both the Challenge and Substance Abuse programs.
Conditions of EXS will be determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant has 51 days of credit.
Appeal rights, WEDs form,  firearms and voting restrictions were provided.

Cash bond remains.
Plea Not Guilty
